message.content:
cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE 

This paper deals with the problem of finding falsifying inputs for hybrid systems, which are systems that combine continuous dynamics with discrete transitions. This is a problem that is typically studied in the field of control theory and formal methods, which falls under the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. However, the paper also proposes a novel algorithm that uses probabilistic search and adapts to the difficulty of the problem, which are techniques that are commonly used in the fields of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and optimization (cs.LO). Additionally, the paper involves the use of temporal logic requirements, which is a topic that is relevant to the sub-category of programming languages (cs.PL). Finally, the paper presents experimental results that demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method, which is a common theme in the sub-category of software engineering (cs.SE).
